intro: Larnandra conopsea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved larnandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Larnandra conopsea is often used in restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil.
